Package org.eclipse.imagen.media.mosaic

Class MosaicDescriptor

Object
OperationDescriptorImpl
MosaicDescriptor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, OperationDescriptor, RegistryElementDescriptor
public class MosaicDescriptor extends OperationDescriptorImpl
This class is very similar to the Mosaic operation because it returns a composition of various images of the same type (same bands and same dataType). This mosaic implementation has two main differences from the first:
  • It doesn't support the threshold weight type.
  • It handles source no data values.
This new behavior can be summarized with this code:
  • Overlay mode 
     // s[i][x][y] = pixel value for the source i
 // d[x][y] = pixel value of the destination
 d[x][y] = destinationNoData;
 for (int i=0; i< sources.length(); i++) {
      if (!SourceNoDataRange[i].contains(s[i][x][y]) {
              d[x][y] = s[i][x][y];
              break;
      }
 }
  • Blend mode. The destination pixel is calculated as a combination of all the source pixel in the same position. 
     // s[i][x][y] = pixel value for the source i
 // w[i][x][y] = weigthed value of the destination
 w[i][x][y] = 0;
 for (int i=0; i< sources.length(); i++) {
      if (!SourceNoDataRange[i].contains(s[i][x][y]) {
              w[i][x][y] = 1;
      }
 }

The operation parameters are:

  • A Java Bean used for storing image data, ROI and alpha channel if present, and no data Range.
  • The type of operation executed(Overlay or Blend) .
  • The destination no data value used if all the pixel source in the same location are no data.

The no data support is provided using the Range class in the ImageN-EXT package.

In this Mosaic implementation the no data support has been added for geospatial images mosaic elaborations. In that images the there could be different type of nodata and a simple thresholding operation couldn't be enough for avoiding image artifacts.

The ROI and alpha mosaic type are equal to those of the classic MosaicOp.

    • create

      public static RenderedOp create(RenderedImage[] sources, MosaicType mosaicType, PlanarImage[] sourceAlpha, ROI[] sourceROI, double[][] sourceThreshold, double[] backgroundValues, Range[] nodata, RenderingHints renderingHints)
      RenderedOp creation method that takes all the parameters, passes them to the ParameterBlockImageN and then call the ImageN create method for the mosaic operation with no data support.
      Parameters:
      sources - The RenderdImage source array used for the operation.
      mosaicType - This field sets which type of mosaic operation must be executed.
      sourceAlpha - source alpha bands
      sourceROI - source ROI
      sourceThreshold - source thresholds
      backgroundValues - This value fills the image pixels that contain no data.
      nodata - array of NoData Range used for checking nodata values
      renderingHints - This value sets the rendering hints for the operation.
      Returns:
      A RenderedOp that performs the mosaic operation with no data support.
